definition: warms the heart and delights the eye (idiom)/pleasing/delightful
to bestow (a reward)/to give (to an inferior)/to hand down/a reward (bestowed by a superior)/to appreciate (beauty)

sentences.english: These blessed flowers were perfect. They didn’t have a single blemish.
sentences.chinese: 這些賞心悅目的花兒真美，它們沒有一處瑕疵。

sentences.english: Other parts of the Hood's exterior are more prepossessing.
sentences.chinese: 小屋外觀的其他部分更賞心悅目。

sentences.english: We can even make a visually engaging wiki with a selection of themes.
sentences.chinese: 通過主題的選擇，可以讓我們的維基網站賞心悅目。

sentences.english: The "on the rack" view in all it's glory.
sentences.chinese: 放在刀架上一觀令人賞心悅目。

sentences.english: I love plants in the house, it just makes everything so much more pleasant.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡室內有植物，它們使一切變得更賞心悅目。

sentences.english: Well, let's move on to today's Feast for the Eyes.
sentences.chinese: 好了，一起來進入我們今天的賞心悅目大飽眼福吧。

sentences.english: The scenic Tangbula Grassland is really an enjoyable sight.
sentences.chinese: 唐布拉草原的風景真是令人賞心悅目啊。

sentences.english: The stainless steel switch can be modified with bezels for raised or flush mounting.
sentences.chinese: 不鏽鋼開關可以被修改爲提高或嵌入式安裝賞心悅目。
應聘者必須擁有令人賞心悅目的體型。

sentences.english: It was a commodious and a diverting life.
sentences.chinese: 這是一種自由自在，令人賞心悅目的生活。

sentences.english: Yeah, but we have to enjoy it in the Feast for the Eyes.
sentences.chinese: 哎，那也要到我們的賞心悅目中去欣賞。

sentences.english: "A thing of beauty is a joy forever" said Endymion.
sentences.chinese: 恩迪米恩說“美好的事物永遠都是賞心悅目的”。

sentences.english: The Rococo decoration inside the palace is delightful.
sentences.chinese: 宮殿內的洛可可式裝飾風格賞心悅目。

sentences.english: It was a good game to watch for the neutrals .
sentences.chinese: 對中立者而言這是一場賞心悅目的比賽。

sentences.english: Golden Rays is also very attractive.
sentences.chinese: 金光閃閃，同樣是賞心悅目。
當然它們也非常賞心悅目。

definition: nothing more beautiful can be imagined (idiom)
to love sth too much to part with it (idiom); to fondle admiringly
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
lit. heart untroubled, spirit pleased (idiom); carefree and relaxed
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
simple and unadorned (of art, architecture etc)
